meanings.definition: A general statement or concept obtained by inference from specific cases.
meanings.sent1: Many people make generalizations about cats being afraid of water.
meanings.sent2: Teachers often use generalizations to help students understand complex ideas.
meanings.sent3: I heard a funny generalization that all birds can sing opera!
meanings.sent4: Her generalization that all politicians are corrupt is quite extreme.
meanings.sent5: The generalization that all fruits are sweet is not always true.

meanings.definition: The act or process of generalizing.
meanings.sent1: The generalizations made by scientists help them draw conclusions.
meanings.sent2: Careful generalizations can lead to better decision-making.
meanings.sent3: I find it amusing how quickly people jump to generalizations.
meanings.sent4: In the world of art, generalizations can be as colorful as a rainbow.
meanings.sent5: The generalizations in psychology textbooks make the subject easier to grasp.
